Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Lymph Node Size as a Prognostic Marker in Esophageal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: 802 patients with locally advanced resectable EC were randomised

Participants.evidence: 802 patients with locally advanced resectable EC

Intervention.evidence: randomised to surgery alone (S) or neoadjuvant chemotherapy plus surgery (C+S)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the prognostic value of LN size in EC patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 5-year overall survival (OS).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 802 patients with locally advanced resectable EC were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: LN size was measured in 367 patients (188 S, 179 C+S)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Large LN size was associated with lower pN category (P = 0.01) and lower lymphatic invasion (P = 0.02)
